Annex 2 / Remuneration

1. Total Remuneration amount / The total Remuneration for providing Services consists of the monthly flat fee and the monthly fee based on calculation. The Remuneration shall be calculated based on the accepted Man-Days in the monthly report of the provided Services.
2. Remuneration structure / The Remuneration includes:
2.1 No on-call services: Remuneration
2.1.1 Hotline service: Included in the monthly flat fee
2.1.2 Emergency service: Included in the monthly flat fee
2.1.3 Service of providing Incident-related consultancy: Included in the monthly flat fee
2.1.4 Service of new version at the Contractor’s initiative: Included in the monthly flat fee
2.1.5 Service of proposals with a view to optimising the Application: Included in the monthly flat fee
2.1.6 Service of proposals with a view to optimising the technological platform: Included in the monthly flat fee
2.1.7 Monthly report service: Included in the monthly flat fee
2.2 On-call services: Remuneration

2.2.1 Incident resolution service: Resolution of Incidents that constitute defects of the Application or Documentation, included in the monthly flat fee Resolution of Incidents that do not constitute defects of the Application or Documentation, included in the monthly fee based on calculation
2.2.2 Change Management service: Included in the monthly fee based on calculation
2.2.3 Expert service: Included in the monthly fee based on calculation

3. Monthly flat fee / The monthly flat fee amounts to 1/12 of the annual flat fee. The annual flat fee amounts to 10% of the total Application value, which is CZK XXX excl. VAT. The list of relevant parts of the Application, together with the determination of their value, which are included in the total value of the Application relevant for the calculation of the amount of the annual flat fee, is attached hereto as Annex 3 (Description of Parts of the Application and Documentation).

4. Monthly fee based on calculation shall be calculated as a product of the number of accepted Man-Days of the relevant activity type in the monthly report of provided services and the relevant price per Man-Day:

This calculation takes into account only the part of the calculated monthly fee based on a calculation exceeding the limit of CZK XXX excl. VAT, which is already included in the monthly flat fee. If the limit has not been used in a given month, the unused part is transferred to the following month, but no more than three times in a row.

5. Re-evaluation of the Application value / The total value of the Application shall be regularly re-evaluated as of 1 January of the relevant calendar year, while the value of individual parts of the Application is adjusted (increased or decreased) by the scope of functionality which was modified during the previous calendar year through the Change Management Service. As part of this re-evaluation, the Client shall also be entitled to re-evaluate the other attributes of the Remuneration calculation and shall have the right to take into account the quality of providing Services, the quantity and severity of the Incidents and the amount of the Remuneration paid by the Client in the previous calendar year to the Contractor, also with respect to other contractual relationships between the Parties.

Annex 3 / Description of Parts of the Application and Documentation
The following items are provided for inspiration only. This annex has to be fully specified by the project manager.
Description of parts of the Application
For the purposes hereof, the Application shall mean the information system SYSTEM, which provides for automation of the AGENDA agenda process and it consists of the following parts:
Name of the part
Definition of the part
Module 1
Work delivered under Contract for Work XXX of DD MM YYYY between the Client and the Contractor, including Amendment A, B
Definition of the module’s scope is listed in the functional specification in Chapter 3-5
Module 2
Module 3
ePortal

Description of parts of the Specification
Intended for business users

1. Functional specification – a detailed description of all business functionalities of the Application, with emphasis on business language (business users must understand what and how the supplied Application will enable automation), a description of the design of all screens of the Application (a description of individual controls and functionalities which provide for data processing) and a description of all print outputs of the Application, with a definition of their design, content, formatting (a description of documents, extracts and printouts)

2. Description of business processes – a document supplementing the Functional Specification – a detailed description of individual life situations of the Application, with emphasis on business language (business users must understand how the Application works in all the situations which it automates)

3. Description of business roles – a document supplementing the Functional Specification – a description of business/user roles of the Application together with a description of their mapping for business processes (business users must understand which type of user carries out the respective processes and know how the attributes of the graphic user interface are mapped for individual business roles)

4. Description of parameterisation – a document supplementing the Functional Specification – a description of the parameterisation of the Application (e.g. description of the product configuration method, description of setting of accounting regulations, description of configuration of code lists, description of configuration of algorithms, ... ), with emphasis on the exact values of individual parameters together with a description of the demonstration of a change in the relevant value of the parameter in the processing of the Application (business users must understand and know exactly how the Application is parameterised and how it responds to individual values of parameters in order to be able to make potential changes where required in the productive operation), description of the transfer of the parameter configuration from the testing environment to the production environment (the Client must be able to consistently transfer the “tested” parameter configuration from an environment where it prepares it to the production environment)
5. Description of UAT scenarios – UAT testing scenarios which are part of the Acceptance Procedure
Intended for an application architect/system integrator

6. Description of data interfaces – a document supplementing the Functional Specification – an exact description of the data interfaces to be made accessible by the Application for other systems, together with a description of the mechanism of their calls, method of validation of individual data items (type, value limits, obligation, ...), error messages, description of necessary performance settings (rate of processing/provision of data, volume of calls in time, ...), description of security settings (method of authentication and authorisation of a calling counterparty)

7. Description of third-party interfaces – a document supplementing the Functional Specification – an exact description of the services and interfaces of third-party systems to be used/called by the Application when active (an exact description of the data structure of the service, call frequency in time, performance settings, ...), description of error messages, description of security settings (similar content than that in the preceding part)

8. Description of performance parameters – a document supplementing the Functional Specification – a description of the performance criteria/parameters to be met by the Application (e.g. the rate of response to open a screen, generating a print output, the number of concurrent users, the maximum duration of closing or export, ...)
Intended for security

9. Description of security features – a document in .docx or .pdf format, supplementing the Functional Specification – an exact description of security algorithms, description of the mechanism of user roles and control of implementing operations by individual users, description of the mechanism of cancelling data in the event of error, description of the mechanism of auditing the implemented operations, description of the application of GDPR requirements, description of the protection of system users and the mechanism of their access to data in the Application, description of change logging, description of the audit of eligibility to implement operations or a description of other features and parameters of the Application related to security and security standards
The current versions of individual parts of the Functional Specification are stored on server SERVER in location LOCATION.
Description of parts of the Documentation
The Documentation of the Application consists of the following parts:
1. User manual/Online help – a manual for business users of the Application

2. Application source codes – the source codes of the Application located on data carrier (such as CD/USB), in a format of the relevant development environment together with the procedure of compiling into executable codes
3. Application data model – an exact description of data entities, their relevance and values, mutual links and dependencies

4. Configuration manual – a technical configuration manual describing what needs to be configured/changed in the Application following the installation so as to be able to carry out tests or operate a live production environment

5. Daily processing image – a time image of how the Application processing works during the day, when users can log into the Application, when they have to log off so as to allow a correct performance of closing or other background processes during which there shall be no data manipulation, and such image should be described for a regular business day as well as for a day of monthly/quarterly/annual closing

6. Administrator’s operations manual – an administrator’s operations manual of the Application describing the activities that must be carried out by the Application’s IT administrator (backup, mandatory/optional background processes, log/error list cleaning, …) so that the Application maintains the prescribed performance parameters
The current versions of individual parts of the Documentation are stored on server SERVER in location LOCATION.

Annex 6 / Project management methodology
1. Project Charter

1.1 The Project Charter aims to define the formal management processes and the method of communication between the Parties in order to meet the subject-matter of the Agreement so that the execution of the work or provision of services is in line with this Agreement and this Project management Methodology. The Project Charter provides persons participating in the execution of the work or provision of services with access to those parts of the Agreement that are necessary for the fulfilment of the subject-matter thereof. The Project Charter defines the composition of the project’s organisational structure, the method of communication, the control and escalation mechanisms and the structure of the project portal where all documentation related to the execution of the work or provision of services is archived. The Project Charter is prepared by project leaders and approved at the initial meeting of the Steering Committee.
2. Project’s organisational structure

2.1 The Project’s organisational components are (1) the Project’s Steering Committee (hereinafter the “PSC”) and (2) the Project’s Project Management (hereinafter the “PPM”) and (3) task forces. The PSC and PPM are the project’s permanent organisational components. Task forces are the project’s temporary organisational components.
3. Steering Committee
3.1 PSC powers / The project’s Steering Committee shall in particular:
3.1.1 approve the Project Charter; and also
3.1.2 deal with escalated issues not resolved at the PPM level; and also
3.1.3 deal with issues impacting the scope of the executed work or provided services; and also
3.1.4 deal with issues relating to the delivery schedule; and also
3.1.5 deal with issues relating to the remuneration or structure of remuneration for the provided services or executed work; and also
3.1.6 accept individual deliveries, services, parts of work or work as a whole; and also

3.2 PSC members / On the part of the Client, the PSC members include (1) the project business sponsor and (2) ISIT Division Director and (3) project leader. On the part of the Contractor, the PSC members include (1) the management’s representative and (2) project leader.

3.3 PSC meetings / The PSC shall meet at least once in a quarter. The specific days when the PSC meets on a regular basis shall be defined by project leaders in the Project Charter. The PSC shall always meet when evaluating a significant milestone of the delivery schedule (such as the commencement or completion of the acceptance procedure). The PSC shall always meet when any project leader requests a PSC meeting. The PSC shall meet in the Client’s registered office.

3.4 PSC meeting agenda / The PSC meeting’s agenda and supporting documents to be discussed shall be delivered to PSC members by the project leader on the part of the Contractor at least 3 business days prior to the PSC meeting. At its meeting, the PSC shall always discuss the project status report and the draft records related to the acceptance of the delivery, services or work.

3.5 Right to invite experts and advisors / If any Party considers it necessary, the Party shall have the right to invite experts or advisors to the PSC meeting; however, it shall inform the other Party of this fact beforehand, also stating the reasons why the presence of experts or advisors in the PSC meeting is useful.

3.6 Voting / Following the discussion of each item on the agenda, the PSC members shall vote on the proposals presented with respect to the respective item on the agenda. Each PSC member has one vote.

3.7 PSC’s decision impacting contractual terms and conditions / Where the PSC decision applies to contractual terms and conditions under which the work is executed or services provided, in particular if the PSC decision impacts the remuneration for which the work is executed or services provided, the Client shall prepare an amendment to the respective agreement without undue delay after adopting such a decision.
3.8 Minutes / Minutes of the PSC meeting shall be drawn up by the project leader on the part of the Client and submit the same to the project leader on the part of the Contractor.
4. Project’s Project Management
4.1 PPM powers / The Project’s Project Management shall in particular:
4.1.1 check all outputs of individual stages of the execution of the work or provision of services; and also
4.1.2 evaluate and specify the delivery schedule and the order of works when executing the work or providing the services; and also
4.1.3 discuss changes with no impact on the wording of the Agreement; and also
4.1.4 manage the cooperation between the Client and the Contractor; and also
4.1.5 manage the risks and remedies related to the execution of the work or provision of services; and also
4.1.6 escalate issues to the PSC meeting.

4.2 PPM members / On the part of the Client, the PPM members include (1) project leader and (2) lead business analyst and (3) application architect. On the part of the Contractor, the PPM members include (1) project leader and (2) lead analyst and (3) lead architect.
4.3 PPM meetings / The PPM shall meet once a week, in the Client’s registered office or via remote communication.

4.4 PPM meeting agenda / The PPM meeting’s agenda and supporting documents to be discussed shall be delivered to PPM members by the project leader on the part of the Contractor at least 1 business day prior to the PPM meeting. At its meeting, the PPM shall always discuss:
4.4.1 the performance of open tasks from the preceding PPMs; and
4.4.2 the progress of executing the work or providing the services; and
4.4.3 the compliance with and update of the work schedule; and
4.4.4 the identified issues and the manner of solution thereof; and
4.4.5 the planned further progress; and
4.4.6 the risks related to the execution of the work or provision of services; and
4.4.7 the evaluation and further requirements for the Client’s assistance; and
4.4.8 the status and severity of unresolved defects or incidents; and
4.4.9 change requests; and

4.5 Right to invite experts and advisors / Where their presence is useful for an effective course of the meeting, both Parties shall have the right to invite experts and advisors or project team members to the PPM meeting.
4.6 Minutes / Minutes of the PPM meeting shall be drawn up by the project leader on the part of the Client and submit the same to the project leader on the part of the Contractor.
5. Task forces

5.1 Task forces / Task forces consist of employees of the Client or the Contractor or of third-party employees. Task forces shall in particular (1) execute specific parts of the work or provided services and (2) provide the know-how required for the execution of the work or provision of services, and (3) provide substantive and professional supporting documents for further decision-making.

5.2 Roles in task forces / The composition of the roles shall always be adapted to the current stage of the execution of the work or provision of services. On the part of the Client, task force members include:
5.2.1 Business analysts of the subject area/areas
5.2.2 Sponsor/key user of the subject area/areas
5.2.3 Technical and technological infrastructure specialist
On the part of the Contractor, task force members include:
5.2.4 Lead consultant/analyst – architect of the proposed solution
5.2.5 Consultant/analyst
5.2.6 Technical infrastructure specialist
5.2.7 Developer
5.2.8 Tester, trainer
5.2.9 Operation and installation specialist
6. The complete summary of composition of individual project roles and their communication matrix shall be defined by the Project Charter.Mutual communication rules

6.1 Conduction communication / Communication in the project is managed mostly by project leaders. Communication is always factual, aimed at resolving individual tasks as fast and as effective as possible. Mutual managed communication of the project teams entails in particular:
6.1.1 Project meetings (PSC, PPM, consultations, workshops, …)
6.1.2 Acceptance and handover procedures
6.1.3 Handover and keeping of tasks, information and documents
6.1.4 Record of change requests
6.1.5 Record of defects and incidents

6.2 Project meetings - agenda and supporting documents / The plan and list of tasks from the project meetings shall always be updated at the next meeting. The supporting documents to be discussed at the project meeting shall be sent by project leaders to the meeting’s participants beforehand, depending on the subject-matter of the meeting. The supporting documents shall be recorded and updated on the project portal.

6.3 Minutes of project meetings / The Client’s project leader shall prepare written minutes of every project meeting and deliver the same to the Contractor’s project leader on the next business day after the project meeting.

6.4 Modifications and supplementation of minutes of project meeting / Modifications and supplementation of minutes of a project meeting shall be prepared by the meeting’s participants within 2 business days after the date of receipt of the minutes. Negotiations on the modifications and supplementation of minutes shall be managed by project leaders. Modifications and supplementation of minutes are not a place to conduct discussion. Following the incorporation of the modifications and supplementation, the Client’s project leader shall close the minutes of project meeting and save the same on the project portal. The deadline for comments on the minutes of project meeting may be changed by project leaders upon agreement. If any deadline for comments on the minutes of project meeting expires with no comments of the meeting’s participants, the minutes shall be considered approved.
7. Risk management

7.1 Risk identification and records / During the execution of the work or provision of services, all persons involved in the execution of the work or provision of services shall identify and subsequently manage, in a documented way, the risks which may affect the quality of the output or the deadlines for executing the work or providing services. The project leaders shall record the risks on the project portal, including their severity.

7.2 Discussion of risks at PPM meeting / Discussing and evaluating risks shall constitute a mandatory item on the agenda of every PPM meeting. The PPM meeting shall lay down measures to eliminate or minimise risks.

7.3 Escalation / Where no agreement is reached or where risk whose severity affects the contractual arrangements or the schedule or the remuneration is identified, such a risk shall be escalated by the PPM to a PSC meeting.
8. Quality management
8.1 The basic tool for managing the quality of the project outputs is the acceptance procedure. The quality verification consists of:
8.1.1 Control of completeness of the subject-matter of the work or provision of services so as to fulfil the purpose of the agreement
8.1.2 Evaluation and handling of comments, defects and incidents so as to fulfil the purpose of the agreement
8.1.3 Control of the currency and completeness of the documentation
8.1.4 Control of compliance with the delivery schedule
8.1.5 Implementation of approved changes
8.1.6 Results of other agreed activities as per the minutes of meeting.

Annex 7 / Incident Classification
The following items are provided for inspiration only. This annex has to be fully specified by the project manager.
Incidents from operational environment
A Category Incident shall mean an Incident in the operational environment, for example:
when the user cannot log into the Application
when the Application repeatedly stops working on the same step and user cannot complete the critical process
when the system reports too long (double as compared to the defined performance parameters)
responses to the user’s activity
when the documentation or report cannot be printed for the client
when incorrect data is displayed to the end customer
Critical functionalities/processes of the Application include:
opening or cancelling an account
starting the daily closing
B Category Incident shall mean an Incident in the operational environment, for example:
when the user's work is slowed down, but it does not have a serious impact on the workflow compliance
when a non-critical functionality is unavailable to the end customer.
C Category Incident shall mean an Incident in the operational environment, for example:
in the case of a language defect or other-than-agreed font
in the case of graphics error in the user interface which does not confuse the user in using the interface
in the case of a defect of the Documentation
Incidents from acceptance environment
TA Category Incident shall mean an Incident in the acceptance environment, for example:
it is not possible to create a client in the system
TB Category Incident shall mean an Incident in the acceptance environment, for example:
it is not possible to change any client account parameter
TC Category Incident shall mean an Incident in the acceptance environment, for example:
in the case of a language defect or other-than-agreed font
in the case of graphics error in the user interface which does not confuse the user in using the interface
in the case of a defect of the Documentation

Annex 9 / Acceptance Procedure
The following items are provided for inspiration only. This annex has to be fully specified by the project manager.
Upgrade Delivery
Acceptance criteria for Upgrade Delivery for commencement of Acceptance Procedure
Delivery of the incremental version of those parts of the Application in the form of executable codes to which the Upgrade applies
Delivery of the current version of the Functional Specification and Documentation of those parts of the Application to which the Upgrade applies

Successful installation of Upgrade to UAT environment according to the installation procedure, where the installation is performed by the Client’s employee with the assistance of the Contractor’s employees

Successful demonstration of the Changes and Incidents included in the Upgrade, with the demonstration performed by Contractor’s employees and marked as successful if 80% of the demonstrated functionality goes smoothly
Acceptance criteria for Upgrade Delivery for performance of Acceptance Procedure
Successful completion of UAT (by implementing all relevant testing scenarios), with UAT completed as successful if the delivered Upgrade contains a maximum of the following Incidents not closed:
TA Category Incident: 0 (none)
TB Category Incident: 3 (three)
TC Category Incident: 10 (ten)
Successful implementation of business-critical scenarios in the UAT environment, with no business-critical scenario reporting a TA, TB or TC Category Incident

The Upgrade Delivery Acceptance Procedure may also be completed if the number of unresolved Incidents from UAT environment that are defects of the Application or Documentation at one time reaches or exceeds the following number of unresolved Incidents:
TA Category Incident: 5 (five)
TB Category Incident: 10 (ten)
TC Category Incident: 30 (thirty)
Patch Delivery
Patch Delivery Acceptance criteria
Delivery of the incremental version of those parts of the Application in the form of executable codes to which the Patch applies

Delivery of the current version of the Functional Specification and Documentation of those parts of the Application to which the Patch applies, and if applicable to the resolution of Incident/Incidents, these parts may be delivered in the next Upgrade
Successful verification of resolution of Incident/Incidents included in Patch, with Patch not reporting any Incidents
If the Patch has not resolved all Incidents included in it, it is up to the Client to decide whether to mark the Acceptance Procedure as successful

Annex 12 / Security Rules
1. Definition of terms
1.1 For the purposes hereof, the following words and terms shall be construed as follows:
Security Incident shall mean any violation of the confidentiality, integrity or availability of the Information Assets.

Information Asset shall mean any information, processes, hardware or software components that (1) support the Beneficiary's business activities, or (2) have value for the Beneficiary, or (3) whose disclosure, unauthorised change or unavailability have a negative impact on the Beneficiary.
Contractor’s Persons shall mean persons who directly or indirectly participate in the performance of the subject-matter of this Agreement, including the subcontractors of the Contractor.

Beneficiary’s Environment shall mean the premises in which Beneficiary carries out its business activities and the information-communication systems used by Beneficiary and containing Information Assets.
2. Personnel security
2.1 None of the Contractor’s Persons:
2.1.1 Has a record in the criminal register;
2.1.2 Has been convicted of an intentional crime in the past and is prosecuted at the time of performance of the subject-matter hereof;

2.2 If the Contractor finds that the Contractor’s Persons do not comply with the above rules, it must immediately notify the Client of this fact. The Client is entitled to request that such a person no longer participates, directly or indirectly, in the implementation of the works arising from the subject-matter hereof and the Client is entitled to claim provision of an adequate replacement from the Contractor.

2.3 The Contractor shall provide the Client with a full name list of the Contractor’s Persons. The Contractor undertakes to inform the Client about changes in personnel in relation to the performance of this Agreement in advance.
2.4 Contractor’s Persons:
2.4.1 must be familiar with these security rules;

2.4.2 have all the necessary examinations and approvals that arise from the law or from the regulator's requirements for the type of work to be performed in connection with the performance of this Agreement;
2.4.3 they are regularly trained by the Contractor in information security.

2.5 The Contractor’s Persons may not enter the Beneficiary’s Environment under the influence of addictive, narcotic or psychotropic substances or bring weapons, explosives, flammable substances, combat means, poisons, radioactive and toxic substances, or any other substances endangering human life and / or health.
3. Physical security
3.1 The access of the Contractor’s Persons to the Beneficiary’s Environment is permitted only if their presence is necessary for the fulfilment of work duties arising from this Agreement.
3.2 The Contractor’s Persons in the Beneficiary’s Environment shall always be accompanied by a responsible employee of the Client.

3.3 Free movement of the Contractor’s Persons in the Beneficiary’s Environment is permitted only if the relevant person was issued a personal access card. The Contractor’s Person is not authorised to lend the access card to third parties or allow third parties to access the Beneficiary’s Environment.
3.4 In the event of loss of an access card or in the event of suspected loss of an access card, the Contractor is obliged to inform the Client without undue delay.

3.5 Without undue delay after the completion of works arising from this Agreement or after the termination of this Agreement or if further physical access of the Contractor’s Persons to the Beneficiary’s Environment is no longer needed, the Contractor shall make sure that all Contractor's Persons return the borrowed access cards to the Client.
3.6 No Information Assets may be removed from the Beneficiary’s Environment by the Contractor’s Person via a storage medium without the prior written consent of Client.
4. Identification and authentication of the Contractor’s Persons in the Beneficiary’s Environment

4.1 The Contractor’s Persons are only assigned accounts allowing for an unambiguous identification of the user and only with such permissions as they necessarily need to perform their work duties under this Agreement.
4.2 Common work activities are carried out by the Contractor under non-privileged accounts, using accounts with administrator privileges only if necessary.
4.3 The Contractor’s Persons shall not access the Internet if they work under an account with administrator privileges or with applications that are launched under administrator privileges.
4.4 Inactive accounts of the Contractor’s Persons are proactively reported by Contractor to the Client.
4.5 Shared accounts shall be used by the Contractor only with a prior written consent of the Client.
4.6 If a password is disclosed or in the event of suspected disclosure of a password, the Contractor shall make sure immediately that the password is changed or blocked.
5. Disposal of certificates
5.1 The access to certificates (logical and physical) shall be enabled only for those Contractor’s Persons in relation to whom such access is necessary for the fulfilment of their work duties.
5.2 Without the written consent of the Client, the Contractor’s Persons may not provide or make available the certificates to third parties.

5.3 After their installation, certificates may be stored only in safe storage on locations where their storage is necessary for the performance hereof and all the other copies shall be destroyed in a manner preventing their recovery.
5.4 If possible, the certificate’s private key must be set to non-exportable. The certificate’s private key must always be protected by strong passwords and it shall not be stored unencrypted.
5.5 The Contractor undertakes to inform the Client without undue delay about a loss or suspected loss of confidentiality of the certificate’s private key.
6. Disposal of Information Assets

6.1 Work with the Information Assets is limited only to locations ruling out espying of sensitive information by unauthorised persons. Specifically, it is prohibited to work with Information Assets in public transport, in public places and in places where there is a risk of espying from industrial cameras.

6.2 Without undue delay after the completion of works arising from this Agreement, the Contractor shall return or remove all the Information Assets stored in the Contractor’s environment, unless the holding of such information is required by the laws of the Czech Republic. The same applies to electronic and paper documents. Information Assets must be removed in a manner preventing their recovery.
6.3 Without a prior written consent of the Client, the Contractor may not provide access to Information Assets to any third parties that are not authorised to participate in the performance hereof.

6.4 The Contractor is obliged to ensure an adequate computer equipment where Information Assets are stored, processed or through which they are transmitted. In relation to Information Assets, the Contractor shall make sure that in the Contractor’s environment:
6.4.1 tools for encrypting disks, folders, or files are used to prevent unauthorised access to the Information Assets;

6.4.2 malware detection and removal tools are used with regular updates of the malware signature database at a frequency not exceeding one week and appropriate processes for monitoring, logging, and responding to positive malware detection are set up;
6.4.3 processes of updating security patches of software components are defined, set, executed and monitored at intervals not exceeding one month from the release of the patches;

6.4.4 the Internet environment is separated by a firewall that is connected to surveillance and the Contractor’s Persons use only encrypted VPN connections preventing unauthorised tapping and change in communication being transmitted when accessing remotely.

6.5 If the Information Assets are transferred by the Contractor outside the Beneficiary’s premises, the Contractor is obliged to take scrupulous care of the physical security of such assets and have these Information Assets under permanent control. The Contractor is obliged to comply with the security and operating instructions of the manufacturer of the hardware where the Information Assets are being processed.
7. Work in Beneficiary’s Environment
7.1 The Contractor is obliged to become acquainted with and act in accordance with the Information Assets classification standard if provided with it by the Client.

7.2 As regards hardware owned and administered by the Client or hardware which, including its configuration, was approved by the Client in advance, the Contractor may not make changes in the configuration of this hardware not approved by the Client. In particular, the Contractor may not make changes in the security configuration of the hardware. As regards each hardware so installed, the process of application of security patches must be explicitly and formally determined, including the responsibilities arising from the roles within the process.
7.3 Without prior written consent of the Client, the Contractor may not install or launch any software not approved by the Client in advance.
7.4 Without written consent of the Client, the Contractor is not authorised to carry out any tests of the physical or logical security or any type of control mechanisms of the Beneficiary.
7.5 The Contractor may not manipulate audit records in any way.
7.6 The Contractor’s Persons are not authorised to work with software, hardware or data content not directly related to the performance hereof.

7.7 The Contractor's Persons may not carry out any activities damaging other natural persons or legal entities, including sending unsolicited e-mails, sending scam e-mails, distributing malicious code or participating in attacks aimed at making services unavailable.
7.8 Any steps taken by the Contractor's Persons are logged and the records is kept for 3 years.
7.9 Without written consent of the Client, the Contractor's Persons may not connect its own memory devices to any computer equipment device of the Beneficiary.
7.10 At the work place provided, the Contractor’s Persons are required to ensure, during periods of physical absence:
7.10.1 cleanliness and order so that the work place could be safely used;
7.10.2 adequate physical security of all Information Assets;
7.10.3 logical locking of access to Information Assets so as to prevent unauthorised access to these Information Assets.
7.11 Without prior written consent of the Client, the Contractor's Persons are not authorised to install devices enabling remote tapping or obtain any audio or video record.
8. Crisis management

8.1 The Contractor's Persons are obliged to prevent as much as possible the occurrence of crisis situations (e.g. fire, explosion, flood, etc.) and situations where persons could be harmed or the Beneficiary’s property damaged.

8.2 In the event of occurrence of a crisis situation, the Contractor's Person who is physically present at the place of the event is obliged, without exception and without undue delay, to comply with the regulations and directives applicable at the relevant location and adhere to the instructions for evacuation and protection of persons. The same applies to training.
8.3 In case of crisis management, the Contractor’s Person is obliged to adhere to the instructions of the Client's crisis manager without delay.
9. Reporting security incidents
9.1 If the Contractor identifies a security incident, it is obliged to report it immediately via https://helpdesk.jtfg.com (telephone No.: +420 221 710 911).

Annex 13 / Contract for Work Content

1. Capitalised terms / All capitalised words and terms whose meaning is not determined by this Contract (hereinafter the “Contract”) shall have the meaning ascribed to them in the Agreement on the Provision of Information System Development and Operation Support Services - Service Level Agreement, covering the maintenance and development of the Application (hereinafter the “SLA”).

2. Subject-matter of the Contract / Under the terms and conditions hereof, for consideration, at its own expense and risk, the Contractor shall execute the Work for the Client, whose specific description is listed in the Change Documentation (hereinafter the “Work”).
3. Deadline for executing the Work / The Contractor shall execute the Work within a deadline listed in the Change Documentation.
4. Price / For a properly executed Work, the Client shall pay the Contractor the Price listed in the Change Documentation (hereinafter the “Price”).
5. Payment of Price / The Client shall pay the Contractor the Price after accepting the Work, in line with the SLA.

6. Other costs of executing the Work / The Price entails any costs of the Contractor associated with the execution of the Work. The Price entails also the expenses spent on third-party performance used by the Contractor when executing the Work, in particular, the costs of performance of subcontractors, including authors and other external licence providers, etc.

7. Default interest / Should the Client fail to pay the Price within its due date, the Client shall pay the Contractor a default interest of 0.05% of the Client’s outstanding amount per each day of the delay. Should the Client fail to pay the Price or part thereof on grounds of the exercise of a claim arising from the defects of the Work, the Client is not in default.
8. Execution of Work / Procedures in line with the SLA shall apply to the execution of the Work.

9. Acceptance Procedure / The place of handover and takeover of the Work shall be the Client’s registered office. In line with the SLA, the Acceptance Procedure shall apply to the acceptance of the Work.
10. Defects of the Work / The Work has a defect if it does not have the attributes laid down herein or in the Change Documentation.
11. Information exchange obligation / The Parties shall mutually exchange all information required for the performance of this Contract.

12. Instructions / Should the Client give a written instruction towards fulfilling the subject-matter hereof and unless such an instruction is contrary to the Parties’ legitimate interests, the Contractor shall comply with such an instruction. The Contractor shall inform the Client of the unsuitability of its instructions without undue delay after such an unsuitable instruction is delivered to the Contractor. If it is impossible to give a required instruction in time, the Contractor shall act diligently at its own discretion and with the knowledge of the Client’s anticipated interests.

13. Obligation of assistance / In order to execute the Work, the Client shall provide to the Contractor all assistance that may be reasonably required from it. Should the Client fail to provide assistance and, therefore, the execution of the Work is delayed, the delivery date shall be extended by the period for which the Client failed to provide assistance.

14. Compliance of the Work with laws / The Contractor shall execute the Work so that it complies with the generally binding legal regulations of the Czech Republic and this Contract. The Work may not violate any third-party intellectual property right or patent protection, trademark, copyright or trade secret.

15. Obligation to execute the Work with due professional care / The Contractor shall execute the Work with the utmost professional care, using the methods and procedures that are the most appropriate in its view.

16. Right to use subcontractors / In order to perform this Contract, the Contractor may use subcontractors. Before the Contractor uses a subcontractor, it shall inform the Client of this fact. The Client shall have the right to refuse using a subcontractor for a serious reason. If the Contractor uses a subcontractor, the Contractor shall be liable for its activities and outputs from the subcontractor’s activities as if those activities were performed by the Contractor itself.

17. Right of control / The Client is entitled to control the execution process of the Work. The Contractor shall allow the Client to perform such control. Should the Client find out that the Contractor runs counter to this Contract, the Contractor shall remove, at its own expense and risk, the deficiencies identified. In order to remove the deficiencies, the Contractor shall be provided with a reasonable additional period depending on the nature of the relevant performance. Such a period shall run from the date on which the Client asked the Contractor for remedy.
18. Ownership of the Work / The Client shall become the owner of the Work at the moment of the Client’s takes over the Work by executing the Record of Acceptance of Upgrade Delivery for Use.

19. Contractual penalty in the event of default / Should the Contractor fail to execute the Work or fail to remove the defects in time, the Contractor shall pay the Client a contractual penalty of 3.3% of the Price and further 0.3% of the Price for each following day of delay.

20. Right to use the Work / By executing this Contract, the Contractor shall grant an exclusive authorisation to the Client to use the Work, as well as the exclusive right to use all parts, components and appurtenances thereof. The Contractor shall neither use the Work nor allow a third party to use the Work.

21. Licences / By concluding this Contract, the Contractor grants an exclusive right to use the Work to the Client. The Client may use the Work in any methods in all countries of the world (all hereinafter the “Licence”). The Price also entails the remuneration for the provision of the Licence. The use of the Work is not conditional upon mutual settlement of the Parties’ obligations.
22. Right to assign the Licence / The Client shall have the right to provide all or any rights associated with the Licence to the Beneficiaries.

23. Liability for legal defects / The Contractor shall be liable that the Work is free of legal defects, that the Work or any part, component or appurtenances thereof are free of third-party rights and that by using the Work, the Client does not violate any third-party intellectual property rights. If a third party exercises its right to the Work or any part, component or appurtenances thereof, the Contractor shall provide the Client, at its own expense, with all possible assistance to protect its rights to the Work and it shall compensate the Client for any damage incurred by the Client due to the defence of its rights to the Work. The Contractor shall in particular compensate the Client for any costs spend by the Client to defend its rights to the Work.

24. Exclusive licence to use copyright works / By concluding this Contract, the Contractor shall grant an exclusive authorisation to the Client to exercise all rights to the copyright works created within the execution of the Work. The exclusive authorisation under the preceding sentence shall be granted by the Contractor to the Client to an unlimited extent in terms of geography and volume as well as in all known methods of use for the entire duration of the copyrights of the author of such a Work. The Client shall have the right to assign or grant the above-mentioned authorisations or only some of them to any Beneficiary. All rights and authorisations under this paragraph hereinafter the “Exclusive Licence to Use Copyright Works”. The Price for the Exclusive Licence to Use Copyright Works is included in the Price.

25. Non-exclusive licence to use copyright works / By concluding this Contract, the Contractor shall grant a non-exclusive authorisation to the Client to use those components of the Work that have not been created based on the Client’s order (such components of the Work hereinafter the “Non-Exclusive Copyright Works”). Non-Exclusive Copyright Works may also be used by the Contractor and other third parties. Non-Exclusive Copyright Works may only be used by the Client for the purposes of using the Work. The Client may not use the Non-Exclusive Copyright Works for a purpose other than the use of the Work. The Client shall have the right to assign or grant the above-mentioned authorisations or only some of them to any Beneficiary. All rights and authorisations under this paragraph hereinafter the “Non-Exclusive Licence to Use Copyright Works”. The use of Copyright Works covered by the Non-Exclusive Licence to Use Copyright Works may not limit or change the use of Copyright Works covered by the Exclusive Licence to Use Copyright Works. The Remuneration for the Non-Exclusive Licence to Use Copyright Works is included in the Remuneration.

26. Penalty for breaching the obligation to deliver a Work free of legal defects / If the Work or any part, component or appurtenances thereof are encumbered by third-party rights or if the licence to use the copyright works is not exclusive for the Client, the Contractor shall pay the Client a contractual penalty of CZK 100,000 per each breach of such obligation.

27. Guarantee of quality, warranty period / The Contractor shall execute the Work free of defects and of the best possible quality. By concluding this Contract, the Contractor assumes the guarantee of quality of the Work and all parts thereof (hereinafter the “Guarantee of Quality”). The Contractor assumes the Guarantee of Quality for two (2) years after the date on which the Client takes over the Work for use (hereinafter the “Warranty Period”).

28. Defect shown during Warranty Period / Where a defect of the Work is shown during the Warranty Period, the Client shall notify the Contractor of the same within one (1) month after the date on which the Client identifies the defect, however, not later than the date on which the Warranty Period expires. Without undue delay after the Contractor receives such a notice, the Contractor shall remove the defect. Defects shown during the Warranty Period shall be removed by the Contractor free of charge. Defects of the Work shall be removed in accordance with the SLA.
29. Breach of the obligation to remover defect during Warranty Period / If the Contractor fails to remove the defect of the Work within a reasonable period, the Client may:
29.1 claim a reasonable discount on the Price; or

29.2 use the source codes and make sure, itself or through a third party, the defect of the Work is removed and the costs of such a removal of the defect shall be borne by the Contractor and all rights arising from the Guarantee of Quality shall remain unchanged; or
29.3 withdraw from this Contract in full or in part.
30. Contractor’s representations / By concluding this Contract, the Contractor represents that
30.1 by concluding and performing this Agreement, it shall not breach any applicable legal regulations of the Czech Republic; and that

30.2 it holds all licenses, consents, registrations or approvals which are necessary for the execution or performance of this Agreement, and that such licenses, consents, registrations or approvals are valid and effective; and that

30.3 it has the expertise and knowledge corresponding to the latest knowledge in the field of information communication technology appropriate for the performance hereof and for the preparation of the Application; and that
30.4 it has the corresponding professional business-technical knowledge and know-how necessary or appropriate for the execution of the Work and preparation of the Application; and that

30.5 it has been thoroughly informed of the Client’s business activities, in particular of its credit processes, and that it has been informed of the applicable laws of the Czech Republic so as to be able to execute the Work in compliance with the Contractor’s business activities and the mentioned laws; and that
30.6 its financial standing and technical equipment and staff is sufficient, on the signature hereof, for proper and timely execution of the Work; and that
30.7 there are no events, facts or circumstances that may be considered as a breach of this Contract.
If any of the Contractor’s representations is false or misleading, the Contractor shall pay the Client a contractual penalty of CZK 10,000 per each such false or misleading representation.

31. Obligation of confidentiality / The obligation of confidentiality and protection of Confidential Information and Banking Information as well as the contractual penalty for breaching the obligations associated with the protection of Confidential Information and Banking Information shall be governed by the SLA. The obligation of confidentiality shall survive the termination hereof.

32. Due date of the sanction / The contractual penalty or another sanction hereunder shall fall due on the date provided in the written call of the Party which became entitled to payment of the contractual penalty or another similar payment.

33. Consequences of payment of the sanction / Payment of the contractual penalty or another sanction hereunder shall be without prejudice to the obligation to pay the contractual penalty or another sanction in the case of a repeated infringement of the same obligation or in the case of infringement of another obligation hereunder. The obligation to pay a liability secured by contractual penalty or another sanction does not lapse with the payment of the contractual penalty or another sanction. Payment of the contractual penalty or another sanction shall be without prejudice to the claim for compensation for damage incurred due to the infringement hereof.

34. Promise of indemnification / The Contractor hereby undertakes to indemnify and hold harmless the Client against any claims, losses, liabilities, obligations, damage, fines, lawsuits, judgements, costs or expenses that may be imposed on the Client, asserted against it or which may be incurred by the Client in any manner whatsoever under this Contract or in demonstrable connection with this Contract or related hereto in any way. The mentioned indemnification could not be applied if any responsibility for the indemnified amount was caused by wilful breach of the Client’s obligations laid down herein or by the Client’s gross negligence.
35. Contact persons, their change and service / The contact persons, their change and service shall be governed by the SLA.

36. Circumstances excluding liability – force majeure / If, irrespective of the Party’s will, there is an obstacle preventing such Party from fulfilling its obligation hereunder and unless it can be reasonably assumed that the obliged Party would avert or overcome such an obstacle or its consequences and unless it can be reasonably assumed that the obliged Party would foresee such an obstacle at the time of occurrence of the liability, the obliged Party may discontinue the performance of its obligations hereunder. Liability is not excluded by an obstacle which occurred at the time when the obliged Party was in delay in complying with its obligation or an obstacle which arose from the obliged Party’s economic conditions. The effects excluding liability are limited only to a period of the obstacle with which these effects are connected. The occurrence of circumstances excluding liability must be reported without undue delay by a Party claiming such circumstances to the other Party. Term and termination of the Agreement
37. Contractor’s right to terminate the Contract / The Contractor shall have the right to terminate this Contract provided
37.1 the Client is late, despite a written call, in paying the Price for more than one (1) month.
However, should the Client fail to pay the Price or part thereof on grounds of the exercise of a claim arising from the defects of the Work, the Client is not in default; or provided

37.2 the Client repeatedly infringes its obligation to provide the Contractor with assistance hereunder despite being called upon to do so in writing with an information about a possible termination of this Contract.
The notice period is two (2) weeks after the notice is served upon the Client.

38. Client’s right to terminate the Contract / The Client shall have the right to terminate this Contract provided the Contractor is late, despite a written call, in executing the Work or any part thereof or in removing defects of the Work for more than two (2) weeks and fails to remedy such a default within a reasonable additional period. The notice period is two (2) weeks after the notice is served upon the Contractor.

39. Right to withdraw from the Contract with immediate effect / Any Party shall have the right to withdraw from this Contract with immediate effect, provided the other Party loses the business licence necessary for the fulfilment of their obligations hereunder or provided insolvency procedure is initiated against the other Party. Withdrawal herefrom shall take effect on the date on which the written withdrawal from this Contract is served upon the other Party.
40. Applicable law / The applicable law shall be governed by the SLA.
41. Amendment of the Contract / This Contract may only be amended in the form of written amendments signed by the Parties.

42. Exercise of rights / If any Party fails to exercise its rights arising from this Agreement or exercises such rights late, it shall not mean that the Party has waived such rights. Each Party can exercise its rights on a recurring basis, in full or in part. The rights covered by this Agreement may be exercised simultaneously. Exercise of the rights arising from this Agreement does not preclude any claims the rights to which arise from legal regulations.

43. Obligation to replace an invalid provision / If a court or national authority decides that a provision of this Agreement is invalid or ineffective, all other provisions hereof and this Agreement as a whole stay in full force and effect. The Parties shall replace such invalid or ineffective provision by a valid and effective provision that shall achieve to the maximum possible extent the intended economic, legal and commercial purposes of the invalid or ineffective provision.
44. Entire Agreement / This Contract constitutes the entire agreement of the Parties on the subject-matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements of the Parties on such subject-matter.
45. Information obligation / Section 1728(2) of the Civil Code shall not apply.
46. Validity and effect / This Contract is valid and effective upon the Client’s acceptance of the Contractor’s offer in the form of the Change Documentation.
